wikipedia_page.main: Ashley Jackson (born 1940) is an English landscape watercolourist. Raised in Barnsley, then in the West Riding of Yorkshire, he opened his first gallery in 1963. He lives in the town of Holmfirth, near Huddersfield, where his gallery is also located.

response: * October 22 – Ashley Jackson, Malaysian-born Yorkshire landscape watercolourist
* Ashley Jackson (historian) (born 1971), British historian and senior lecturer
* Ashley Jackson (field hockey) (born 1987), English field hockey player

Many famous names have written for Dalesman, including J. B. Priestley, Ella Pontefract, Bill Cowley and Alan Bennett.  Current regular contributors include "Bard of Barnsley" Ian McMillan, Nicholas Rhea, who wrote the Constable books that the TV series Heartbeat was based on, Ashley Jackson (artist), and cartoonists Tony Husband and Karl Dixon.
